column1: Words
寂しい means lonely, sad, or desolate. Example: あなたがいなくて寂しいです。I miss you when you are not here. 寂しいと感じることはありませんか。Don’t you ever feel lonely?.
容易い means easy, simple, or facile. Example: この問題は容易いです。This problem is easy. 容易いことではありません。It is not a simple matter.
四角い means square or rectangular. Example: 私たちは四角いテーブルに座った。We sat at a square table). 彼は四角い顔をしている。He has a square face. この箱は四角い形をしている。This box is square-shaped.
涼しい means cool, refreshing, or pleasant. Example: 涼しい風が吹いている。A cool breeze is blowing. 涼しい飲み物が欲しい。I want a refreshing drink.
詳しい means detailed, specific, or well-informed. Example: 詳しい説明をしてください。Please give me a detailed explanation. 彼は歴史に詳しいです。He is well-informed about history.
尊い means precious, valuable, or noble. Example: 尊い命を失った。He lost his precious life. 尊い教えを守る。To follow the noble teachings.
ぎこちない means awkward, clumsy, or stiff. Example: ぎこちない挨拶をした。He made an awkward greeting. ぎこちない動きをする。To move clumsily.
心細い means helpless, anxious, or insecure. Example: 心細い思いをする。To feel helpless. 心細くなるような話をしないでください。Please don’t say things that make me feel insecure.
素早い means quick, fast, or agile. Example: 素早く走る。To run quickly. 素早く反応する。To react fast.
上手い means skillful, clever, or delicious. Example: 上手に描く。To draw skilfully. 上手く話す。To speak cleverly. 上手く料理する。To cook deliciously.
小高い means slightly elevated, hilly, or rising. Example: 小高い山に登る。To climb a slightly elevated mountain. 小高い丘から眺める。To look from a hilly hill.
仕方無い means inevitable, unavoidable, or helpless. Example: 仕方無いことだから諦める。To give up because it is inevitable. 仕方無く参加する。To participate reluctantly.
涼しい means cool, refreshing, or pleasant. Example: 涼しい風が吹いている。A cool breeze is blowing. 涼しい飲み物が欲しい。I want a refreshing drink.
厚い means thick, deep, or heavy. Example: 厚い本を読む。To read a thick book. 厚い雪が積もっている。There is deep snow piled up. 厚いメイクをする。To put on heavy makeup.
下らない means worthless, trivial, or nonsense. Example: 下らない話をする。To talk about worthless things. 下らないことに怒らないで。Don’t get angry about trivial things. 下らないものは見ないでください。Please don’t watch nonsense things.
辛抱強い means patient, persevering, or enduring. Example: 辛抱強く待つ。To wait patiently. 辛抱強く続ける。To continue perseveringly. 辛抱強く耐える。To endure enduringly.
用心深い means cautious, careful, or prudent. Example: 用心深く歩く。To walk cautiously. 用心深く話す。To speak carefully. 用心深く考える。To think prudently.
緩い means loose, slack, or lenient. Example: 緩いベルトを締める。To tighten a loose belt. 緩い糸を引っ張る。To pull a slack thread. 緩い規則を守る。To follow lenient rules.
冷たい means cold, cool, or unfriendly. Example: 冷たい水を飲む。To drink cold water. 冷たい空気を感じる。To feel cool air. 冷たい態度をとる。To take an unfriendly attitude.
酷い means terrible, awful, or cruel. Example: 酷い目にあう。To have a terrible experience. 酷い言葉を言う。To say awful words. 酷い仕打ちをする。To do cruel treatment.
難しい means difficult, hard, or complicated. Example: 難しい問題を解く。To solve a difficult problem. 難しい言葉を覚える。To remember hard words. 難しい状況に陥る。To fall into a complicated situation.
優しい means kind, gentle, or nice. Example: 優しい人に出会う (To meet a kind person) or 優しい声で話す (To speak with a gentle voice) or 優しい気持ちになる (To feel nice).
深い means deep, profound, or intense. Example: 深い海に潜る (To dive into the deep sea) or 深い考えにふける (To indulge in profound thoughts) or 深い愛情を抱く (To hold intense affection).
寒い means cold, chilly, or unpleasant. Example: 寒い日に外出する (To go out on a cold day) or 寒い目で見られる (To be looked at with chilly eyes) or 寒い冗談を言う (To say an unpleasant joke).

思いがけない means unexpected, surprising, or unforeseen. Example: 思いがけないプレゼントをもらう (To receive an unexpected gift) or 思いがけない出来事に驚く (To be surprised by a surprising event) or 思いがけない事態に対処する (To deal with an unforeseen situation).
うざい means annoying, irritating, or bothersome. Example: うざい音を止めて (Stop the annoying noise) or うざい人に会いたくない (I don’t want to meet irritating people) or うざいことを言わないで (Don’t say bothersome things).
夥しい means numerous, plentiful, or abundant. Example: 夥しい本を持っている (To have numerous books) or 夥しい食べ物を用意する (To prepare plentiful food) or 夥しい資源を利用する (To use abundant resources).
怠い means lazy, drowsy, or sluggish. Example: 怠い朝を過ごす (To spend a lazy morning) or 怠い目をこする (To rub drowsy eyes) or 怠い動きをする (To make sluggish movements).
酸っぱい means sour, acidic, or tart. Example: 酸っぱいレモンを食べる (To eat a sour lemon) or 酸っぱい匂いがする (To smell an acidic odor) or 酸っぱい味がする (To taste tart).
数え切れない means countless, innumerable, or incalculable. Example: 数え切れない星を見る (To see countless stars) or 数え切れない人が集まる (To gather innumerable people) or 数え切れない恩がある (To have incalculable favors).
清々しい means refreshing, invigorating, or exhilarating. Example: 清々しい風を感じる (To feel a refreshing breeze) or 清々しい気分になる (To become invigorated) or 清々しい笑顔を見せる (To show an exhilarating smile).
痛い means painful, hurtful, or sore. Example: 痛い傷を負う (To suffer a painful wound) or 痛い言葉を言われる (To be told hurtful words) or 痛い筋肉をほぐす (To loosen sore muscles).
短い means short, brief, or concise. Example: 短い髪を切る (To cut short hair) or 短い時間で済ます (To finish in a brief time) or 短い文章を書く (To write a concise sentence).
青白い means pale, ashen, or bluish-white. Example: 青白い顔色をする (To have a pale complexion) or 青白い光を放つ (To emit an ashen light) or 青白い花を咲かせる (To bloom bluish-white flowers).
つまんない means boring, dull, or uninteresting. Example: つまんない本を読む (To read a boring book) or つまんない話を聞く (To listen to a dull story) or つまんない人生を送る (To lead an uninteresting life).
粘り強い means tenacious, persistent, or resilient. Example: 粘り強い交渉をする (To do tenacious negotiations) or 粘り強い努力を続ける (To continue persistent efforts) or 粘り強い精神を持つ (To have a resilient spirit).
不味い means bad-tasting, unpalatable, or nasty. Example: 不味い料理を食べる (To eat a bad-tasting dish) or 不味い水を飲む (To drink unpalatable water) or 不味い冗談を言う (To tell a nasty joke).
虚しい means empty, vain, or futile. Example: 虚しい気持ちになる (To feel empty) or 虚しい栄誉を得る (To gain vain honor) or 虚しい努力をする (To make futile efforts).
醜い means ugly, hideous, or disgusting. Example: 醜い顔をする (To make an ugly face) or 醜い犯罪を犯す (To commit a hideous crime) or 醜い行為を嫌う (To detest disgusting acts).
懐かしい means nostalgic, reminiscent, or dear. Example: 懐かしい思い出を語る (To talk about nostalgic memories) or 懐かしい場所に行く (To go to a reminiscent place) or 懐かしい人に会う (To meet a dear person).
美しい means beautiful, lovely, or gorgeous. Example: 美しい景色を見る (To see a beautiful scenery) or 美しい歌声を聞く (To hear a lovely singing voice) or 美しいドレスを着る (To wear a gorgeous dress).
正しい means correct, right, or proper. Example: 正しい答えを選ぶ (To choose the correct answer) or 正しい判断をする (To make the right judgment) or 正しい態度をとる (To adopt a proper attitude).
勇ましい means brave, gallant, or valiant. Example: 勇ましい戦士になる (To become a brave warrior) or 勇ましい行動をとる (To take a gallant action) or 勇ましい姿を見せる (To show a valiant figure).
遠い means far, distant, or remote. Example: 遠い国に行く。To go to a far country. 遠い親戚に会う。To meet a distant relative. 遠い星を眺める。To gaze at a remote star.
鈍い means dull, slow, or blunt. Example: 鈍いナイフで切る。To cut with a dull knife. 鈍い反応をする。To make a slow response. 鈍い痛みを感じる。To feel a blunt pain.
めでたい means auspicious, happy, or celebratory. Example: めでたい日を祝う。To celebrate an auspicious day. めでたいニュースを聞く。To hear a happy news. めでたい席に招かれる。To be invited to a celebratory seat.
誇らしい means proud, honorable, or glorious. Example: 誇らしい成績を収める。To achieve a proud result. 誇らしい歴史を持つ。To have an honorable history. 誇らしい勝利を得る。To gain a glorious victory.
違いない means certain, sure, or no doubt. Example: 彼は成功する違いない。He will succeed for certain. これは本物のダイヤモンド違いない。This is a real diamond for sure. 彼女は幸せだ違いない。She is happy no doubt.
少ない means few, little, or scarce. Example: 少ない時間で仕事を終わらせる。To finish work in a few time. 少ないお金で暮らす。To live on little money. 少ない水で済ます。To make do with scarce water.
余儀ない means inevitable, unavoidable, or compelled. Example: 余儀なく退場する。To be inevitably dismissed. 余儀なく逃げる。To be unavoidably run away. 余儀なく従う。To be compelled to obey.
訝しい means doubtful, suspicious, or questionable. Example: 訝しい話を聞く。To hear a doubtful story. 訝しい人物に出会う。To encounter a suspicious person. 訝しい行動をする。To do a questionable action.
易しい means easy, simple, or facile. Example: 易しい問題を解く。To solve an easy problem. 易しい言葉で説明する。To explain in simple words. 易しい仕事をする。To do a facile job.
限り無い means endless, unlimited, or eternal. Example: 限り無い可能性を持つ。To have an endless potential. 限り無い自由を求める。To seek an unlimited freedom. 限り無い愛を誓う。To vow an eternal love.
強い means strong, powerful, or intense. Example: 強い力を持つ。To have a strong force. 強い影響を与える。To give a powerful influence. 強い感情を抱く。To harbor an intense emotion.
逞しい means sturdy, robust, or tough. Example: 逞しい体を作る。To build a sturdy body. 逞しい精神力を持つ。To have a robust mental strength. 逞しい生き方をする。To live a tough life.
怪しい means suspicious, dubious, or fishy. Example: 怪しい音がする (To hear a suspicious sound) or 怪しい人に話しかけられる (To be talked to by a dubious person) or 怪しい取引をする (To do a fishy deal).
憎い means hateful, detestable, or abominable. Example: 憎い敵を倒す (To defeat a hateful enemy) or 憎い行為をする (To do a detestable act) or 憎い虫を殺す (To kill an abominable bug).
細かい means small, fine, or detailed. Example: 細かい字を書く (To write a small letter) or 細かい粉にする (To make a fine powder) or 細かい点を確認する (To check the detailed points).
忙しい means busy, occupied, or hectic. Example: 忙しい一日を過ごす (To spend a busy day) or 忙しい仕事に追われる (To be chased by an occupied work) or 忙しいスケジュールをこなす (To handle a hectic schedule).
弱い means weak, feeble, or frail. Example: 弱い力しか出せない (To only exert a weak force) or 弱い声で話す (To speak in a feeble voice) or 弱い体質を持つ (To have a frail constitution).
羨ましい means enviable, jealous, or covetous. Example: 羨ましい旅行をする (To do an enviable trip) or 羨ましい人生を送る (To lead a jealous life) or 羨ましい物を持つ (To have a covetous thing).
喧しい means noisy, loud, or boisterous. Example: 喧しい音楽を聞く (To listen to noisy music) or 喧しい声で叫ぶ (To shout in a loud voice) or 喧しい子供たちを見る (To see boisterous children).
恥ずかしい means embarrassing, shameful, or awkward. Example: 恥ずかしい失敗をする (To make an embarrassing mistake) or 恥ずかしい秘密を持つ (To have a shameful secret) or 恥ずかしい場面に遭う (To encounter an awkward situation).
諄い means tedious, repetitious, or long-winded. Example: 諄い話を聞く (To listen to a tedious story) or 諄い説明をする (To do a repetitious explanation) or 諄い文章を書く (To write a long-winded sentence).
心地良い means comfortable, pleasant, or cozy. Example: 心地良い空気を吸う (To breathe a comfortable air) or 心地良い音を聞く (To hear a pleasant sound) or 心地良い家に住む (To live in a cozy house).
可笑しい means funny, strange, or ridiculous. Example: 可笑しいジョークを言う (To tell a funny joke) or 可笑しい話を聞く (To hear a strange story) or 可笑しい要求をする (To make a ridiculous demand).
凄まじい means fierce, shattering, or tremendous. Example: 凄まじい戦闘に参加する (To participate in a fierce battle) or 凄まじい音がする (To make a shattering sound) or 凄まじい力を持つ (To have a tremendous power).
しつこい means persistent, annoying, or greasy. Example: しつこい売り込みを断る (To refuse a persistent sales pitch) or しつこい虫を追い払う (To drive away an annoying bug) or しつこい料理を食べる (To eat a greasy dish).
険しい means steep, grim, or harsh. Example: 険しい山道を登る (To climb a steep mountain path) or 険しい表情をする (To make a grim expression) or 険しい現実に直面する (To face a harsh reality).
親しい means close, familiar, or intimate. Example: 親しい友人と話す (To talk with a close friend) or 親しい言葉で呼ぶ (To call by a familiar name) or 親しい関係になる (To become intimate).
危ない means dangerous, risky, or unsafe. Example: 危ない場所に行く。To go to a dangerous place. 危ない賭けをする。To make a risky bet. 危ない運転をする。To do an unsafe driving.
大きい means big, large, or great. Example: 大きい家に住む。To live in a big house. 大きい声で話す。To speak in a large voice. 大きい影響を与える。To have a great influence.
軽い means light, easy, or frothy. Example: 軽い荷物を持つ (To carry a light luggage) or 軽い仕事をする (To do an easy job) or 軽い飲み物を飲む (To drink a frothy beverage).
果てしない means endless, eternal, or unending. Example: 果てしない空を見る (To see an endless sky) or 果てしない愛を誓う (To vow an eternal love) or 果てしない苦しみに耐える (To endure an unending pain).
暗い means dark, gloomy, or dull. Example: 暗い部屋に入る (To enter a dark room) or 暗い気分になる (To become gloomy) or 暗い色を着る (To wear a dull color).
宜しい means good, fine, or advisable. Example: 宜しいお返事をお待ちしております (I look forward to your favorable reply) or 今日は宜しいでしょうか (Is today fine?) or 早めに行く方が宜しい (It is advisable to go early).
脆い means fragile, brittle, or vulnerable. Example: 脆いガラスを割る (To break a fragile glass) or 脆い骨を折る (To fracture a brittle bone) or 脆い心を傷つける (To hurt a vulnerable heart).
有り難い means grateful, thankful, or appreciative. Example: 有り難いご支援に感謝します。I appreciate your generous support. 有り難いご意見を頂きました。I received your valuable opinion. 有り難いことに無事でした。Thankfully, I was safe.
久しい means long, old, or distant. Example: 久しい友人に再会する (To reunite with an old friend) or 久しい夢を叶える (To fulfill a long dream) or 久しい昔の話をする (To tell a distant past story).
嬉しい means happy, glad, or pleased. Example: 嬉しいニュースを聞く (To hear a happy news) or 嬉しいサプライズを受ける (To receive a glad surprise) or 嬉しいお知らせがあります (I have a pleased announcement).
遅い means late, slow, or delayed. Example: 遅い電車に乗る (To ride a late train) or 遅い反応をする (To make a slow reaction) or 遅い支払いを受ける (To receive a delayed payment).
多い means many, much, or numerous. Example: 多い人に会う (To meet many people) or 多いお金を使う (To spend much money) or 多い問題に直面する (To face numerous problems).
近い means near, close, or similar. Example: 近い場所に行く (To go to a near place) or 近い関係になる (To become close to someone) or 近い考えを持つ (To have a similar idea).
気安い means easygoing, friendly, or casual. Example: 気安い人と話す (To talk to an easygoing person) or 気安い雰囲気を作る (To create a friendly atmosphere) or 気安い服装で出かける (To go out in a casual outfit).
荒っぽい means rough, violent, or coarse. Example: 荒っぽい遊びをする (To play roughly) or 荒っぽい言葉を使う (To use violent words) or 荒っぽい肌触りの布を触る (To touch a coarse fabric).
広い means wide, spacious, or broad. Example: 広い道路を走る (To drive on a wide road) or 広い部屋に住む (To live in a spacious room) or 広い視野を持つ (To have a broad perspective).
小さい means small, little, or tiny. Example: 小さい文字を読む (To read small letters) or 小さい子供を抱く (To hold a little child) or 小さい声で話す (To speak in a tiny voice).
軟らかい means soft, tender, or gentle. Example: 軟らかい毛布に包まる (To wrap oneself in a soft blanket) or 軟らかい肉を食べる (To eat tender meat) or 軟らかい日差しを浴びる (To bask in gentle sunshine).
疑わしい means dubious, questionable, or suspicious. Example: 疑わしい話をする (To tell a dubious story) or 疑わしい証拠を見つける (To find a questionable evidence) or 疑わしい人物に出会う (To meet a suspicious person).

ややこしい means complicated, troublesome, or confusing. Example: ややこしい問題を解く (To solve a complicated problem) or ややこしい関係に巻き込まれる (To get involved in a troublesome relationship) or ややこしい説明を聞く (To listen to a confusing explanation).
早い means early, fast, or soon. Example: 早い時間に起きる (To wake up early) or 早いスピードで走る (To run fast) or 早い回復を祈る (To pray for a soon recovery).
でかい means huge, giant, or enormous. Example: でかい建物を見る。To see a huge building. でかい動物と戦う。To fight a giant animal. でかいケーキを食べる。To eat an enormous cake.
あり得ない means impossible, unbelievable, or incredible. Example: あり得ないことを言う。To say something impossible. あり得ない話を聞く。To hear an unbelievable story. あり得ない光景を目撃する。To witness an incredible scene.
悔しい means regretful, frustrating, or bitter. Example: 悔しい思いをする。To feel regretful. 悔しい敗北を味わう。To taste a frustrating defeat. 悔しい涙を流す。To shed bitter tears.
卑しい means greedy, dirty, or despicable. Example: 卑しい行為をする。To do a greedy act. 卑しい言葉を使う。To use dirty words. 卑しい人間になる。To become a despicable person.

煩わしい means annoying, bothersome, or troublesome. Example: 煩わしい電話を受ける (To receive an annoying phone call) or 煩わしい手続きを済ませる (To finish a bothersome procedure) or 煩わしい人に付きまとわれる (To be followed by a troublesome person).
辛い means spicy, painful, or hard. Example: 辛いカレーを食べる (To eat spicy curry) or 辛い別れを経験する (To experience a painful farewell) or 辛い生活を送る (To lead a hard life).
臭い means smelly, foul, or stinky. Example: 臭いゴミを捨てる (To throw away smelly garbage) or 臭い水を飲む (To drink foul water) or 臭い靴下を洗う (To wash stinky socks).
煩い means noisy, loud, or boisterous. Example: 煩い音楽を聞く (To listen to noisy music) or 煩い声で話す (To talk in a loud voice) or 煩い子供たちに注意する (To warn boisterous children).
速い means fast, quick, or swift. Example: 速い車に乗る (To ride a fast car) or 速い返事をする (To make a quick reply) or 速い動きを見せる (To show a swift movement).
著しい means particular, remarkable, or significant. Example: 著しい進歩を遂げる (To achieve remarkable progress) or 著しい差をつける (To make a significant difference) or 著しい注意を払う (To pay particular attention).
空しい means empty, hollow, or vain. Example: 空しい気持ちになる (To feel empty) or 空しい言葉を言う (To say hollow words) or 空しい努力をする (To make vain efforts).
目覚ましい means remarkable, striking, or amazing. Example: 目覚ましい成果を上げる (To produce remarkable results) or 目覚ましい変化を見せる (To show striking changes) or 目覚ましい才能を持つ (To have amazing talent).
明るい means bright, cheerful, or optimistic. Example: 明るい色を選ぶ (To choose a bright color) or 明るい性格を持つ (To have a cheerful personality) or 明るい未来を信じる (To believe in an optimistic future).
弱々しい means weak, feeble, or frail. Example: 弱々しい声で話す (To speak in a weak voice) or 弱々しい体を鍛える (To train a feeble body) or 弱々しい植物を育てる (To grow a frail plant).
粗い means coarse, rough, or crude. Example: 粗い布地を使う (To use coarse fabric) or 粗い肌触りを感じる (To feel rough texture) or 粗い言葉を吐く (To spit crude words).
騒がしい means noisy, fussy, or boisterous. Example: 騒がしいバーに行く (To go to a noisy bar) or 騒がしい子供をあやす (To soothe a fussy child) or 騒がしいパーティーに参加する (To join a boisterous party).
荒い means rough, wild, or coarse. Example: 荒い海を渡る (To cross a rough sea) or 荒い生活を送る (To lead a wild life) or 荒い言葉遣いをする (To use coarse language).
硬い means hard, stiff, or rigid. Example: 硬いパンを食べる (To eat hard bread) or 硬い首をほぐす (To loosen a stiff neck) or 硬い規則に従う (To follow rigid rules).
苦しい means painful, hard, or tight. Example: 苦しい思いをする (To have a painful experience) or 苦しい生活をする (To live a hard life) or 苦しい予算をやりくりする (To manage a tight budget).
若い means young, youthful, or fresh. Example: 若い人に話しかける (To talk to a young person) or 若い感性を持つ (To have a youthful sensibility) or 若い野菜を収穫する (To harvest fresh vegetables).
相応しい means suitable, appropriate, or fitting. Example: 相応しい服装を選ぶ (To choose suitable clothes) or 相応しい言葉を使う (To use appropriate words) or 相応しい処置をとる (To take fitting measures).
力強い means powerful or forceful. Example: 彼は力強い演説をした (He gave a powerful speech). 2) 彼女は力強い意志を持っている (She has a strong will). 3) 彼の力強い握手に感動した (I was impressed by his firm handshake).
激しい means violent or intense. Example: 彼女は激しい怒りを感じた (She felt intense anger). 2) その嵐は非常に激しかった (The storm was very violent). 3) 彼は激しいトレーニングをしている (He is doing intense training).
しんどい means tiresome or tough. Example: 今日は本当にしんどい一日だった。Today was a really tough day. この仕事はとてもしんどい。This job is very tiresome. 長時間の運転はしんどいものだ。Long hours of driving are tough.
丸い means round or circular. Example: 彼女は丸い顔をしている。She has a round face.彼は丸い眼鏡をかけている。He wears round glasses. 私たちは丸いテーブルに座った。We sat at a round table.
図々しい means impudent or shameless. Example: 彼は図々しい態度で話した。He spoke with an impudent attitude. 彼女は図々しくも私の食べ物を食べた。She shamelessly ate my food. 彼の図々しい要求には驚いた。I was surprised by his brazen demand.

腹立たしい means irritating or exasperating. Example: 彼の言動は腹立たしいものだった。His words and actions were exasperating. 電車が遅れて腹立たしかった。It was irritating that the train was late. 彼女の腹立たしい態度に我慢できなかった。I couldn’t stand her exasperating attitude.
覚束無い means shaky or unreliable. Example: 彼の証言は覚束無かった。His testimony was unreliable. 私の記憶が覚束無くなってきている。My memory is becoming shaky. 彼女の計画は覚束無かった。Her plan was unreliable.
甚だしい means extreme or excessive. Example: 彼の遅刻は甚だしかった。His lateness was excessive. 彼女は甚だしく不満を訴えた。She complained excessive. その料理の辛さは甚だしかった。The spiciness of the dish was extreme.
目まぐるしい means dizzying or chaotic. Example: 彼女のスケジュールは目まぐるしいものだった。Her schedule was chaotic. 市場の目まぐるしい変化についていけなかった。I couldn’t keep up with the dizzying changes in the market.
慌ただしい means busy or hectic. Example: 彼女は慌ただしく出かけた。She left in a hurry. 今日は慌ただしい一日だった。Today was a busy day. 彼の仕事は慌ただしいものだ。His job is hectic.
大人しい means quiet or gentle. Example: 彼女の犬はとても大人しいです。Her dog is very gentle. 彼は大人しい性格をしている。He has a quiet personality. 彼女は大人しくて控えめな人だ。She is a quiet and reserved person.
渋い means astringent or bitter. Example: このお茶は渋い味がする。This tea has a bitter taste. 彼の渋い声に魅了された。I was fascinated by his astringent voice. 彼女は渋い色の服を着ていた。She was wearing clothes in astringent colors.
潔い means pure or noble. Example: 彼女は潔く負けを認めた。She nobly admitted defeat. 彼は潔く謝罪した。He apologized purely. 彼女の潔さに感動した. I was moved by her purity.
可愛らしい means lovely or cute. Example: あなたはとても可愛らしいです。You are very lovely. この子犬は可愛らしいですね。This puppy is cute, isn’t it? 彼女は可愛らしい笑顔を見せた。She showed a lovely smile.
良い means good or nice. For example, 今日は良い天気です。Today is a nice weather. これは良い本です。This is a good book. 彼は良い人です。He is a good person.
手早い means nimble, quick or agile. Example: 彼は手早く料理を作った。He cooked quickly. 彼女は手早く荷物をまとめた。She packed her luggage nimbly. 彼らは手早く逃げた。They escaped agilely.3
白い means white. Example: 白い歯。White teeth. 白い皿。White plate. 白い雪。White snow.
素っ気ない means cold, short, curt or blunt. Example: 彼は素っ気ない返事をした。He gave a cold reply. 彼女は素っ気ない態度で話した。She spoke with a curt attitude. 彼は素っ気ない言葉で別れた。He parted with blunt words.
薄暗い means dim or gloomy. Example: 薄暗い部屋で本を読んだ。I read a book in a dim room. 薄暗い空に星が見えた。I saw stars in the gloomy sky. 薄暗い森に入った。I entered the dim forest.
長い means long. Example: 長い髪。Long hair. 長い道。Long road. 長い話。Long story.
肌寒い means chilly or cool. Example: 肌寒い朝。A chilly morning. 肌寒い風。A cool wind. 肌寒い季節。A cool season.
無い means not have, not exist or none. Example: お金が無い。I don’t have money. 彼はもうここには無い。He is not here anymore. 無いものねだりをする。To ask for the impossible.
情けない means miserable, abject or pathetic. Example: 情けない姿。A miserable sight. 情けない負け方。A pathetic loss. 情けない気持ち。A abject feeling.
柔らかい means soft, tender or gentle. Example: 柔らかい布。A soft cloth. 柔らかい肉。Tender meat. 柔らかい声。Gentle voice.
太い means thick, fat or heavy. Example: 太い本。A thick book. 太い指。A fat finger. 太い声。A heavy voice.
輝かしい means brilliant, glorious or splendid. Example: 輝かしい日曜日。A brilliant Sunday. 輝かしい作戦。A glorious strategy. 輝かしい将来。A splendid future.
若々しい means youthful, young or fresh. Example: 若々しい顔。A youthful face. 若々しい活力。A young vitality. 若々しい感性。A fresh sensibility.
物凄い means tremendous, terrific or awful. Example: 物凄い音。A tremendous noise. 物凄いスピード。A terrific speed. 物凄い目にあう。To have an awful experience.
手堅い means solid, steady, secure, certain or reliable. Example: 手堅い商人。A solid merchant. 手堅い方法。A reliable method. 手堅い勝ち。A steady win.
薄い means pale, light, thin, dilute or weak. Example: 薄い色。A pale color. 薄い本。A thin book. 薄い味。A weak taste.
貧しい means poor, needy or impoverished. Example: 貧しい家庭。A poor family. 貧しい国。A needy country. 貧しい生活。An impoverished life.
細長い means slender, slim or elongated. Example: 細長い指。slender fingers. 細長い道。Slim road. 細長い形。Elongated shape.
涙ぐましい means tearful, touching or moving. Example: 涙ぐましい努力。Tearful effort. 涙ぐましい物語。Touching story. 涙ぐましい姿。Moving figure.
望ましい means desirable, preferable or welcome. Example: 望ましい結果。Desirable result. 望ましい選択。Preferable choice. 望ましい訪問。Welcome visit.
惜しい means regrettable, disappointing or precious. Examples: 惜しい負け。Regrettable loss. 惜しいチャンス。Disappointing chance. 惜しい人。Precious person.
凄い means amazing, awesome or terrible. Example: 凄いスピード。Amazing speed. 凄い芸術家。Awesome artist. 凄い嵐。Terrible storm.
呆気ない means anticlimactic, disappointing or abrupt. Example: 呆気ない結末。Anticlimactic ending. 呆気ない敗北。Disappointing defeat. 呆気ない別れ。Abrupt farewell.
堪らない means unbearable, intolerable or irresistible. Example: 堪らない痛み。Unbearable pain. 堪らない苦しみ。Intolerable suffering. 堪らなく好き。Irresistible love.
